head.supplied: [At the monthly meeting of the Vinegrowers' Association on Wednesday afternoon Mr. T. Hardy drew attention to the telegram appearing in the ¶ Register ¶ on August 26, ¶ 'The Bendigo vineyards. A pro...

div.p: From the South Australian Vinegrowers Association

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Letter not found. The text given here is from the report of a meeting of the South Australian Vinegrowers' Association held on 28 August 1895, South Australian register, 29 August 1895, p. 4.

p.seg: [At the monthly meeting of the Vinegrowers' Association on Wednesday afternoon Mr. T. Hardy drew attention to the telegram appearing in the

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: 'The Bendigo vineyards. A proposal to replant', South Australian register, 26 August 1895, p. 6.

p.seg: with reference to the proposal to replant the vine yards in the Bendigo district, which were up-rooted owing to the presence of phylloxera with American phylloxera-resisting cuttings to be imported from America, and also to the stand taken by Baron von Mueller in condemning the importation of cuttings.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: See M to J. Pescott, 17 August 1895, and notes thereto.

p.seg: Mr. Hardy said they were deeply indebted to Baron von Mueller for what he had done, and he moved— "That the President and the Secretary of the Association write to Baron von Mueller, thanking him on behalf of the South Australian vinegrowers for the stand he had taken in this direction;

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

p.seg: and also that the Government be asked to draw the attention of the Victorian Government to the same matter." This was carried.]
